summary: The 'Crawfish Recovery Assistance from Weather Disasters And Droughts Act' (CRAWDAD Act) aims to improve drought-related disaster assistance programs within the Department of Agriculture. It amends the Agricultural Act of 2014 to include crawfish in emergency assistance programs for farm-raised fish, livestock, and honey bees impacted by adverse weather or drought. The bill also tasks the Secretary of Agriculture to establish documentation standards for crawfish production and loss conditions due to drought.
